name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 pound chicken breasts or thighs, cut into large bite-size chunks
0.5 cup heavy cream or sour cream
directions: Marinate chicken: Combine 1 cup yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger + 1 tbsp garlic, 1 tbsp garam masala, 0.5 tsp cayenne, 0.5 tsp black pepper, and 1 tsp salt. Add 1 lb chicken cubes and toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or up to 24 hours. Grill chicken in a 450F pre-heated oven under the broiler for 15-20 minutes, or on kabobs on grill until chicken is charred in center is tender. To make the sauce: Heat a large heavy-duty pan to medium/high heat. Add 2 tsp oil, 2 tbsp butter, and 0.5 cup onion. Cook until onion begins to brown. Add the jalapeno, 3 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp ginger and cook for 2 minutes or until garlic begins to brown. Add the 1 cup tomatoes, 2 tbsp tomato paste and spices (1 tbsp garam masala, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp salt). Cook for 5 minutes. Pour in 1 cup of water and allow mixture to simmer on a low/medium heat for 15 minutes. Add 1 cup cream and cook for just 2-3 minutes. Mix in the cooked chicken and stir to coat
notes: For 2 tbsp garam masala (1 for marinade & 1 for sauce) combine: 1.5 tsp cumin, 1.5 tsp coriander, 1 tsp cardamom, 1 tsp black pepper, 1 tsp cinnamon. For recipe: omit water & shorten time; less cayenne?
